NAME: Lakshaya Goel
ABOUT:
I am a SDE 2 with 4+ years of experience at Microsoft (Seattle). I have recently relocated to Delhi. 

You can reach me at lakshayawork@gmail.com.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Created a file system with complete memory management akin to that found in operating systems today. Had to simulate the organization of memory into fixed size blocks with virtual and physical memory. Also implemented a priority based scheduler for system processes which controlled creation, deletion and resource management.

The English translation being ‘thieving politician’, this is a game I am developing in which players play a politician aspiring to become the president of India. They make choices which affect the public’s image of them and ultimately deem whether they can become president in a fixed amount of turns.

Designed a game from scratch complete with movement animations, keyboard/mouse control, sound effects, and a fully functional enemy AI. The game was made using the Java Swing library, and incorporated themed character sprites as well as event triggers, special moves and various levels.

Developed an assembly-level simulator that takes as input assembly code, compiles it to binary, and simulates running the program on an LC4 processor. Machine state was simulated via a program counter, status registers, control signals, and memory separated by user and OS space.
